metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5125 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 58 and Firefox ESR 52.6. Someof these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.7, Firefox ESR < 52.7, andFirefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
